title: Drawing, "Cutlery Designs", 1815–30
markings: Watermark: Bottom part of a shield with a beehive.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite beside the first server:  GPB (rb'44)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Shown upright in a row from left:  A two-forked spoon.  A dresser, showing a monogram GF in a laurel wreath.  A dresser, showing a fish in a wreath and surrounded by rinceaux.  A spoon, shown from the inside, showing circular bands with a chain and with palmette motifs, respectively, moldings, and a rosette in the center.  A soupspoon shown sidewise with the spout.  A knife.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Cutlery Designs", 1815–30.
1815–30. Graphite, pen, brush, ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5783.
